definition[0]: to write down something exactly as it was said
example[0]: A secretary transcribed the witnessesâ€™ statements.
definition[1]: to write an exact copy of something
example[1]: He had been asked to transcribe an ancient manuscript.
definition[2]: to represent speech sounds with phonetic symbols
definition[3]: to change a piece of writing into the alphabet of another language
example[2]: The book has been transcribed into braille.
definition[4]: to arrange a piece of music for a different instrument or voice
definition[5]: to copy recorded music, speech etc from one system to another, for example from tape to CD
